sense.name: Cover or enclose.
sense.commentary: Includes: WRAP AROUND, WRAP UP NOTE: May be abstract or metaphorical.
sense.examples: She wrapped the blindfold around my eyes. They had just wrapped the Bern Museum in translucent plastic. Mommy wrapped the Christamas presents up and put them under the tree. Mother Fong took off her coat and wrapped the baby up carefully. Monica wrapped the flag around her body and smiled coyly.

sense.name: Wind around.
sense.commentary: Includes: WRAP AROUND, WRAP UP NOTE: Object winding around must be long or flat; object wound around must be cylindrical. This sense does not entail that the object being wound around is covered partially or completely by the winding object. The line at the ticket booth wrapped around the block.
sense.examples: Wrap the paper around thin dowels. Wrap the yarn around the spool again. Wrap the rope around your arm to tidy it up. My dad always wrapped the handlebars in double-sided cloth tape. The boy wrapped the rope tight around his neck and jumped.

sense.name: Finish a task completely
sense.examples: We should have wrapped the game up before half-time. Bass N Bucks wrapped up the 2007 season yesterday. African leaders wrapped up the first summit of the AU yesterday. Yesterday we wrapped up the majority of our projects for PDC.

sense.name: Guide around an object or a set of objects.
sense.examples: Beckham wrapped the ball around a wall of defenders.
